headline: Emerson (EMR) Earnings Growth Tops Five-Year Trend, Reinforcing Bullish Margin and Valuation Narratives
summary: Emerson Electric (EMR) delivered earnings growth of 19.7% over the past year, a sharp contrast to its five-year average decline of 1.3% per year. Net profit margins improved to 12.4% from last year's 10.9%, supported by high-quality earnings and an attractive dividend. With shares trading at $132.45, analysts note the price remains well below a discounted cash flow estimate of $356.40. The company's 33.8x P/E ratio looks expensive relative to the US electrical industry average but offers...

headline: Rockwell tops fourth-quarter profit, revenue estimates on automation demand
summary: Demand for automation has remained strong from companies revamping their factory floors to help offset labor shortages.  U.S. President Donald Trump'⁠s tariffs have ‌hit companies across sectors.  Rockwell in May said that it would offset ‍the tariff hit by streamlining its pricing and supply chain.
